content.description:
Face climbing on pockets and edges, could use more cleaning/traffic.  8 bolts lead to a ledge halfway up.  The thin crack leading to the summit may take gear and go to the Bow Wave anchors

Not sure if this 2nd half has been done yet.
content.protection: 8 bolts to first anchors at ledge.  continue with gear for an adventure.  You can rappel the route with one 60m rope.

content.description: This really fun line, front and center on the crag, has lots of the typical dolomite features, pockets, dishes, edges, and flakes.  But what sets this line apart is the cool blade at the top of the route.  The position and exposure while hand traversing the blade are amazing!  Most of the climbing is 5.9ish, with some occasional 5.10, and just a couple spots of 5.11.
content.protection: 21 bolts.  Descend by rappelling the route to the right.  There are two stations so you can do it with one rope.
content.location: Bow Wave is easily distinguishable due to the large blade/flake system at the top of the route.  It's just a few minutes walk along the base from the Moderate Wall.
